intro: Ficinia overbergensis, commonly known as the Overberg sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Ficinia overbergensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
